sentence: The war cry for justice was all over - Much to the chagrin of the authorities.
Latvian: Karš raudāt par taisnīgumu bija vairāk - daudz, lai chagrin no iestādēm.
backtrans: War crying for justice was more - much to Chagrin from the authorities.

sentence: The regime's decision adumbrates the underlying agenda.
Latvian: Režīma lēmums uzsver pamatā esošo darba kārtību.
backtrans: The decision of the regime emphasizes the underlying agenda.

sentence: The community was anxious over the passing of the much needed reforms.
Latvian: Kopiena bija noraizējusies par ļoti nepieciešamo reformu nodošanu.
backtrans: The Community was worried about the transfer of the very necessary reforms.

sentence: The think tank  published a paper outlining their apology of capital punishment.
Latvian: Think tvertne publicēja papīru, kurā izklāstīta viņu atvainošanās par nāvessodu.
backtrans: The Think Tank published a paper outlining their apology for the death penalty.

sentence: Aught was left of the petition's validity
Latvian: Auzht tika atstāts no lūgumraksta derīguma
backtrans: Auzht was left out of the petition's validity

sentence: The President exhorted his ministers to buckle up as key opposition support for his economic plan was about to buckle.
Latvian: Prezidente aicināja ministrus, lai sprādzētu kā galveno opozīcijas atbalstu viņa ekonomikas plānam, bija apmēram sprādze.
backtrans: The President invited ministers to bleed as the main opposition support to his economic plan, was about a buckle.

sentence: The voters were chuffed to see the bill passed.
Latvian: Vēlētāji tika sajaukti, lai redzētu rēķinu.
backtrans: Voters were mixed to see the bill.

sentence: The lawyer's discursive narration swayed the jury.
backtrans: Lawyer's discursive narration fascinates the jury.

sentence: The EU block opposed an eventual imposition of anti-dumping measures.
Latvian: ES bloks iebilda pret iespējamo antidempinga pasākumu noteikšanu.
backtrans: The EU block objected to the possible imposition of anti-dumping measures.

sentence: A fulsome eulogy was delivered by the sly counsel.
Latvian: Fulsome Eulogy tika piegādāts ar viltīgu padomu.
backtrans: Fulsome Eulogy was delivered with cunning advice.

sentence: The gig-economy agency decided to garnish the refunds!
Latvian: Gig ekonomikas aģentūra nolēma izdomāt kompensācijas!
backtrans: GIG Economic Agency decided to figure out compensation!

sentence: Members of the anti-theocratic revolutionary movement overthrew the peers in power!
Latvian: Antiokrātiskās revolucionārās kustības locekļi sagrāva spēku vienaudžus!
backtrans: The members of the antiocratic revolutionary movement destroyed the power of peers!

sentence: The traitors disappointingly decided to fight with the colonialists.
Latvian: Traiters neapmierina nolēma cīnīties ar koloniālistiem.
backtrans: The traiter does not satisfy decided to fight the colonialists.
